channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2107] Hail Fail (pic)
[+2092] How to Say 'Fuck You' in Any Language Worldwide (Infograph)
item.description: Print out this handy little guide and learn; for cursing in a foreign language is just about as cool as having a girlfriend that dresses up as slave Leia to play kinky games with you.

item.title: [+1892] 7 Bullshit Police Myths Everyone Believes (Thanks to Movies)
item.description: Since most of us don't have the slightest clue about the judicial system, we just take Hollywood's word for it. Their no good, filthy word.

item.title: [+1654] Firefox 3.6 Released
item.description: After months of testing, Mozilla has finally released Firefox 3.6, the newest version of its popular browser.The new edition of Firefox sports a new array of features, least of which is an increase in speed — 20% faster than Firefox 3.5, according to Mozilla. It uses Gecko 1.9.2 web-rendering, which improves its load times, startup speeds, etc.

item.title: [+1555] TSA screener torments woman, then gets what he deserves
item.description: The 22-year-old student would be flying into Detroit on Northwest Airlines, the same city and carrier involved in the attempted bombing on Christmas, just 10 days before. She was tense. What happened to her lasted only 20 seconds, but she says they were the longest 20 seconds of her life. ... The jackass TSA screener isn't likely to forget either.

item.title: [+1476] xkcd - Dirty Harry
[+1384] Soldiers Blow Up Tanker With Grenades (Video)
item.description: A couple soldiers use the grenade launcher attachments on their rifles to explode a crashed gas tanker in the desert.

item.title: [+1062] Grayson: Fight now or "kiss your country goodbye"
item.description: Progressive firebrand Rep. Alan Grayson eviscerated the Supreme Court ruling on campaing finance and urged action or we could be dealing with the "Congressman from Wal-Mart."

item.title: [+916] Digg to Undergo Drastic Overhaul
item.description: “In the next version of Digg you’ll see stories being presented to you in a more real-time nature, especially stories that your friends have touched. item.title: [+750] A Secret Garage (pics)
[+694] Review: Firefox 3.6 brings joy to Web devs, not just users
item.description: Mozilla has officially released Firefox 3.6, a significant update of the popular open source Web browser. Ars takes a hands-on look at the new version and the enhancements that it offers for Web developers and regular end users.

item.title: [+677] YouTube Will Start Charging for Some Videos
item.description: Starting this weekend, YouTube will be dipping its toe into the waters of paid content. This behavior follows a trend we've noted in traditional media outlets. What are your thoughts on the topic?
